meanings.definition: To endure or bear together with another or others.
meanings.sent1: We coendure the challenges of life as a team.
meanings.sent2: Families often coendure hardships to support each other.
meanings.sent3: The friends decided to coendure the long hike by encouraging each other.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was so strong that they could coendure any obstacle together.
meanings.sent5: The bond between siblings can coendure any test of time.

meanings.definition: To endure or bear with patience.
meanings.sent1: I coendure the slow progress of the project with a calm attitude.
meanings.sent2: She had to coendure the tedious wait for her turn.
meanings.sent3: He tried to coendure the boring lecture by doodling in his notebook.
meanings.sent4: Patience is needed to coendure the delays in life's journey.
meanings.sent5: The wise old man could coendure any challenge with a peaceful mind.
